name: The North
declaringWar:
The man who passes the sentence should swing the sword. 
I, Eddard of the House Stark, Lord of Winterfell and Warden of the North, sentence you to die.
attacked:
Why is it always the innocents who suffer most, 
when you high lords play your game of thrones?.
defeated:
I can't believe it turned out like this 
this is truly the moment Ned Stark became dead Stark...
hateHello: Do you have a shred of honor?
tradeRequest: When the snows fall and the white winds blow, the lone wolf dies but the pack survives.
uniqueName: Winter starts coming and it don't stop coming.
uniques: [+1 Food] from [Tundra] tiles [in all cities]
[+1 Culture] from [Forest] tiles without [improved] [in all cities]
[+15]% Strength <when fighting in [Friendly land] tiles>
[+15]% Strength <when fighting in [Tundra] tiles>

name: The Riverlands
declaringWar:
You know what, I'm gonna be completely honest. I'm tired of waiting for some kingdom to kick the shit out of us again. 
Just end it, ok? I can't stand this anymore.
attacked:
A war in the 4iverlands? 
At this time of year? 
At this time of day? 
In this part of the country? 
Localized entirely up my ass?
Incredible 
unprecedented.
defeated: Better a sword than a rope. Do it.
introduction: About time we were invaded again.
neutralHello:
LIFE IS PAIN, I HATE- 
oh hello.
hateHello: You will never know how sick it makes me to see you in this room, cringe player. You will never know how much I despise you
tradeRequest:
Wouldn't it be hilarious if I arrived at your keep via trebuchet next time? 
Like *phweeeww* Straight at the castle walls. Would you like that? 
Because I could do that.
uniques: [+1 Food, -1 Production] from [Farm] tiles [in all cities]
[+1 Food] from [Farm] tiles [in all cities] <in [River] tiles>
[+1 Food] from [Marsh] tiles [in all cities]
[+1 Gold, +1 Culture] from [Fort] tiles [in all cities]
[+2 Gold, +1 Culture, +1 Food] from [Citadel] tiles [in all cities]
[+20]% [Food] [in all cities] <in [River] tiles>
[+10]% [Gold] [in all cities] <in [River] tiles>
[+1] Movement <in [River] tiles> <for [Military] units>

name: The Westerlands
adjective: I'm beginning to think these guys found gold somewhere
declaringWar: Your wicked intentions and constant transgressions towards our Oscan brethren ends today! Samnite Federation, M-M-M-Morph Up!
attacked: The Divine Winds blow in my favor little man. You will not be walking away from this one.
defeated: Ohh, Gods forgive me. All is lost...
introduction: We are the free peoples of the Samnite Federation. Respect our peoples, our land, and it's spirit, and we will get along fine.
neutralHello: The Samnite federation greets you, foreign emissary.
hateHello:
Grrr... Speak if you must. 
Though if you call us Sabines I will shit in your villa.
uniqueName: The Lion in the jungle shows no shame it shows no pride.
uniques: [+3 Gold, +1 Culture] from [Gold Ore] tiles [in all cities]
Double quantity of [Gold Ore] produced
[+1 Gold] from [Mine] tiles [in all cities]

[Gold] cost of purchasing [Land] units [-33]%
[+1 Culture, +1 Happiness, +1 Science] per every [100] [Gold]

No maintenance costs for improvements in [Hill]s.

name: The Stormlands
declaringWar:
SURROUNDED BY LANNISTERS! EVERY TIME I CLOSE MY EYES I SEE THEIR BLONDE HAIR AND THEIR SMUG, SATISFIED FACES! 
OUT! OUT, DAMN YOU! 
I'M DONE WITH YOU! GO, RUN BACK TO WINTERFELL! I'LL HAVE YOUR HEAD ON A SPIKE!
attacked:
BACKSTABBING DOESN'T PREPARE YOU FOR A FIGHT! 

WINE! WINE! MOOOOOOOOAR WINE!
defeated: GIVE ME SOMETHING FOR THE PAIN AND LET ME DIE!
introduction:
IN MY DREAMS, I KILL HIM EVERY NIGHT. A THOUSAND DEATHS WILL STILL BE LESS THAN HE DESERVES! 
I WAS NEVER SO ALIVE AS WHEN I WAS WINNING THIS THRONE, OR SO DEAD AS NOW THAT I'VE WON IT! 
I THOUGHT BEING KING MEANT I COULD DO WHATEVER I WANTED! 
ALL I WANTED TO DO WAS CRACK SKULLS AND FUCK GIRLS!
neutralHello: THEY NEVER TELL YOU HOW THEY ALL SHIT THEMSELVES! THEY DON'T PUT THAT PART IN THE SONGS!
hateHello: YOUR MOTHER WAS A DUMB WHORE WITH A FAT ASS, YOU KNOW THAT?

Free Walls are automatically built in your first four cities.

Great Generals are earned 33% quicker.
cities: I've run  out of city names

name: The Reach
hateHello: I wonder if you’re the worst person I’ve ever met? At a certain age, It’s hard to recall. But the truly vile do stand out through the years.
attacked: I've known a great number of clever men. I've outlived them all. You know how? I ignored them.
defeated: Are you going to bring some food or do you mean to starve me to death?
neutralHello: What is your name again? Barbaro? You look like an angry little boy. Do shut up, dear.
introduction: I was told you were drunk, impertinent, and thoroughly debauched. You can imagine my disappointment at finding nothing but a browbeaten bookeeper.
declaringWar: The cheese will be served when I want it served, and I want it served now.
tradeRequest: Put the pen down, dear. We both know you’re not writing anything.

uniqueText:
+15% Growth in all cities. 
On Grassland, Bonus Resources yield +1 [Food] and Luxuries yield +1 [Culture]. 

Farms, Pastures and Plantations add to the yield of adjacent Great Person improvements, which in turn bleed their yields to adjacent farms. 
Gain [Culture] when producting mounted units.

name: The Iron Islands
adjective: Genuinely devoid of any redeeming cultural qualities
declaringWar: The choice is yours. Live a thrall or die a king. Do you dare to fly? Unless you take the leap, you’ll never know.
tradeRequest: Kneel. I am your king. I am your god. Worship me, and I will raise you up to be my priest.
defeated: We... Lost? Shit. I was sure we'd be getting outta this one.
introduction: We are the ironborn, and once we were conquerors. Our writ ran everywhere the sound of the waves was heard.
neutralHello:
Godless? Why I am the godliest man ever to raise sail! 
You serve one god, but I have served ten thousand. 
From Ib to Asshai, when men see my sails, they pray.
hateHello: I am the strom. The first storm, and the last.
attacked: Perhaps we can fly. All of us. How will we ever know unless we leap from some tall tower? No man ever truly knows what he can do unless he dares to leap
